name: SearchParameter
description: A search parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.

elements.name: id
elements.short: Logical id of this artifact
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.short: Metadata about the resource
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.short: Language of the resource content
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.short: Contained, inline Resources
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this search parameter, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this search parameter is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the search parameter is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the search parameter
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the search parameter author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this search parameter (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the search parameter. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: derivedFrom
elements.short: Original definition for the search parameter
elements.description: Where this search parameter is originally defined. If a derivedFrom is provided, then the details in the search parameter must be consistent with the definition from which it is defined. i.e. the parameter should have the same meaning, and (usually) the functionality should be a proper subset of the underlying search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
elements.description: The status of this search parameter. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this search parameter is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.short: Date last changed
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the search parameter was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the search parameter changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.short: Contact details for the publisher
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the search parameter
elements.description: And how it used.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate search parameter instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for search parameter (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the search parameter is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this search parameter is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this search parameter is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.short: Code used in URL
elements.description: The code used in the URL or the parameter name in a parameters resource for this search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: base
elements.short: The resource type(s) this search parameter applies to
elements.description: The base resource type(s) that this search parameter can be used against.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: type
elements.short: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri | special
elements.description: The type of value that a search parameter may contain, and how the content is interpreted.

binding.description: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: expression
elements.short: FHIRPath expression that extracts the values
elements.description: A FHIRPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: xpath
elements.short: XPath that extracts the values
elements.description: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: xpathUsage
elements.short: normal | phonetic | nearby | distance | other
elements.description: How the search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating the xpath query.

binding.description: How a search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating its xpath query.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: target
elements.short: Types of resource (if a resource reference)
elements.description: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: multipleOr
elements.short: Allow multiple values per parameter (or)
elements.description: Whether multiple values are allowed for each time the parameter exists. Values are separated by commas, and the parameter matches if any of the values match.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: multipleAnd
elements.short: Allow multiple parameters (and)
elements.description: Whether multiple parameters are allowed - e.g. more than one parameter with the same name. The search matches if all the parameters match.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: comparator
elements.short: eq | ne | gt | lt | ge | le | sa | eb | ap
elements.description: Comparators supported for the search parameter.

binding.description: What Search Comparator Codes are supported in search.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: modifier
elements.short: missing | exact | contains | not | text | in | not-in | below | above | type | identifier | ofType
elements.description: A modifier supported for the search parameter.

binding.description: A supported modifier for a search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: chain
elements.short: Chained names supported
elements.description: Contains the names of any search parameters which may be chained to the containing search parameter. Chained parameters may be added to search parameters of type reference and specify that resources will only be returned if they contain a reference to a resource which matches the chained parameter value. Values for this field should be drawn from SearchParameter.code for a parameter on the target resource type.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: component
elements.short: For Composite resources to define the parts
elements.description: Used to define the parts of a composite search parameter.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.short: Additional content defined by implementations
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: definition
elements.short: Defines how the part works
elements.description: The definition of the search parameter that describes this part.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: expression
elements.short: Subexpression relative to main expression
elements.description: A sub-expression that defines how to extract values for this component from the output of the main SearchParameter.expression.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
